name: Measuring liquidity in agricultural land markets

author.name: Marlene Kionka
author.affiliation: Department of Agricultural Economics, Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin

author.name: Martin Odening
author.affiliation: Department of Agricultural Economics, Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin

author.name: Jana Plogmann
author.affiliation: Department of Agricultural Economics, Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin

author.name: Matthias Ritter
author.affiliation: Department of Agricultural Economics, Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin

abstract: Liquidity is an important aspect of market efficiency. This paper discusses indicators of liquidity in agricultural land markets, reflects on determinants of market liquidity, and analyzes the relationship with land prices through an empirical analysis for Germany.
subject: C32
C33
Q13
Q24
citation: Kionka, M., Odening, M., Plogmann, J., & Ritter, M. (2022). Measuring liquidity in agricultural land markets. Agricultural Finance Review, 82(4), 690-713. https://doi.org/10.1108/AFR-03-2021-0037

dataset.name: Lower Saxony Farmland Transactions Dataset
dataset.description: Dataset includes 72,547 sale transactions of arable land in Lower Saxony, Germany, from 1990 to 2018.

variable_measured.name: Sold Area
variable_measured.description: Area of land sold in the transaction

variable_measured.name: Seller Information
variable_measured.description: Information if the seller is a farmer

dataset.conditions_of_access: Data provided by the Oberer Gutachterausschuss für Grundstückswerte in Niedersachsen

funding: Financial support from the German Research Foundation (DFG) through Research Unit 2569 'Agricultural Land Markets – Efficiency and Regulation'

extraction_metadata.reasoning: The extraction process involved identifying key metadata elements from the provided text, focusing on bibliographic details and dataset information related to farmland transactions. The article's title, authors, and affiliations were clearly stated, allowing for accurate extraction. The journal name, volume, issue, and page numbers were also explicitly mentioned. The abstract provided a summary of the research focus, which is crucial for understanding the context of the datasets. The dataset description was derived from the empirical analysis section, which detailed the data used in the study, including the number of transactions and the geographic focus on Lower Saxony, Germany. The temporal coverage was extracted from the dataset description, which mentioned the years 1990 to 2018. The extraction confidence is high due to the clarity and completeness of the provided information.
processing_notes: API: OpenAI Responses API with structured outputs
